org.simplity.kernel.db

Interface DbClientInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BlockWorker, DbAction.Worker

    public interface DbClientInterface
    Interface to be implemented by a class that wants to work with RdbDriver. 
     Typical way of working is:
 1. call driver to get a connection.
 2. work with connection.
 3. call driver to return/close connection.
    Connection and records set are such crucial resources, that we do not want to take any chance. Hence instead of the above sequence, we have devised the following. 
     1. call static method RdbDriver.workWithDriver(callbackObject, dbAccessType)
 2. driver will create an appropriate driver object instance
 3. calls callbackObject.workWithDriver(rdbdriverInstance);
 4. close connection, and release all resources associated with rdbDriver instance.
 5. control is returned back to you. (workWithDriver() returns.)

 even if you keep rdbDriverInstance, it can not be used for any operation, as it is not in that state.
    Author:
    simplity.org

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean workWithDriver(DbDriver driver)
      use an instance of rdbDriver to take care of all your rdb operations.

    • Method Detail

      • workWithDriver

        boolean workWithDriver(DbDriver driver)
        use an instance of rdbDriver to take care of all your rdb operations. Note that the rdbDriver instance will work only inside this method. You should not keep a pointer to this instance beyond this method. However, even if you do, the instance CAN NOT be used for any rdb operation, because it would have released all resources.
        Parameters:
        driver -
        Returns:
        true if operation is successful. All operations are committed. False in case any error, in which case operations are rolled-back.
